committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Energy Conservation and Power

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Power Act to specify the annual charges for projects with licenses issued by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for the use of federal dams and other structures.

summary.as: Senate agreed to House amendment with amendment
summary.text: (Senate agreed to House amendment with an amendment) Amends the Federal Power Act to provide that the annual charge for a license issued under such Act for the development and utilization of power created by any Government dam shall not exceed one mill per kilowatt-hour for the first 40 gigawatt-hours of energy a project produces, 1 1/2 mills per kilowatt-hour for over 40 and up to 80 gigawatt-hours, and two mills per kilowatt-hour for any energy the project produces over 80 gigawatt-hours. Provides that no annual charge shall be assessed in those cases where the United States has already entered into a contract with a licensee that provides that: (1) such licensee may build and own power plants using irrigation facilities constructed by the United States; (2) such powerplant shall remain in the exclusive control or ownership of the licensee; and (3) all revenues derived from such power plants shall remain the property of the licensee. Requires the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to review and report to Congress every five years on the appropriateness of the annual charge limitations under this Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Power Act to specify the annual charges for projects with licenses issued by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for the use of federal dams and other structures.
